abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column examines trends showing corporate donations should no longer be primary target of campaign finance reform; observes some 28 public companies have agreed to disclose political spending following push by New York State Comptroller Thomas P DiNapoli, undercutting their perceived eagerness to control elections; holds greater danger is from extremely wealthy individuals with clear ideological preferences.
lead_paragraph: With companies increasing their disclosures about contributions, perhaps campaign finance reformers should turn their attention elsewhere.

headline.main: Corporations Open Up About Political Spending
headline.print_headline: Companies Open Up on Giving in Politics

snippet: With companies increasing their disclosures about contributions, perhaps campaign finance reformers should turn their attention elsewhere.

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)

keywords.value: New York State Common Retirement Fund
